All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractPlayer
A player of a game.
AiTUI
 
AiTUI.State
 
Board
Board for the BoxAndDot game.
BoardTest
Testing the board.
ClientConnection
This is the class which is in charge of handling and sending messages to the server socket.
ClientHandler
This class handles the client and its interactions with the server.
ClientListener
This interface is designed for the TUI.
ComputerPlayer
This is the class of a computer player.
connectionListener
Keep logs of the chat by writing all received messages to a file.
DotAndBoxClient
 
DotAndBoxClient.ClientState
This class defines States.
DotAndBoxClientTUI
 
DotsGame
Represent a DotsAndBoxes game: keep track of whom the players and whose turn it is.
DotsMove
Represent a move in the game, i.e., store the mark to place and the location to place it.
Game
A simple turn-based game.
GameServer
This class hosts the server for the game Dots and boxes.
GameTest
Testing the gameLogic.
GameTUI
This is the game TUI, which was made to test an offline game between 2 people.
Helper
This is the Helper class, which has additional self-written functions to facilitate the flow of program.
HumanPlayer
This is the class for a Human Player.
Mark
Represents a mark in Dots and Boxes game.
Move
A move in a turn-based game.
NaiveStrategy
This class is the NaiveStrategy of ComputerPlayer.
Player
A player of a turn-based game.
Protocol
This is the class that contains all required protocols for communication of the program.
ServerConnection
This class maintains/encapsulates the connection to the client, handles the input/output streams (because it subclasses SocketConnection), decodes/parses messages FROM THE CLIENT according to the protocol, and encodes/generates messages TO THE CLIENT according to the protocol.
ServerConnection.State
This class defines States.
ServerError
This is the exception class for handling errors for the server.
SmartStrategy
This class is the Smart Strategy of ComputerPlayer.
SocketConnection
Wrapper for a Socket and implements reading messages that consist of a single line from the socket.
SocketServer
Implements a networking server which accepts connection from clients.
Strategy
The interface of Strategy.
WrongFormatProtocol
This is the written exception.
